clash.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: if two armies, groups etc clash, they start fighting – used in news reports
clash.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Police have clashed with demonstrators again today.
clash.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: if two people or groups clash, they argue because they have very different beliefs and opinions – used in news reports
clash.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Democrats clashed with Republicans in a heated debate.
The two men have clashed over the report’s conclusions.
clash.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: if two colours or designs clash, they look very bad together
clash.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: I can’t wear red – it clashes with my hair.
clash.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: if two events clash, they happen at the same time in a way that is inconvenient
clash.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: The announcement has been delayed to avoid clashing with the prime minister’s speech.
clash.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: if two pieces of metal clash, or if you clash them, they make a loud ringing sound
clash.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a short fight between two armies or groups – used in news reports
clash.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: violent clashes between police and demonstrators
clash.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: an argument between two people or groups because they have very different beliefs or opinions – used in news reports
clash.translation[1].definitions[1].note: personality/culture clash (=a situation in which two people or groups do not like each other)
clash.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: The plans put oil companies in a head-on clash with environmentalists.
clash.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: a sports match between two teams, players etc that is expected to be very exciting – used in sports reports
clash.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: The heavyweight clash goes ahead in Las Vegas on 8 May.
clash.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: a situation in which two events happen at the same time in a way that is inconvenient
clash.translation[1].definitions[4].defi: a loud sound made by two metal objects hitting each other
clash.translation[1].definitions[5].defi: a combination of two colours, designs etc that look bad together
clash.translation[1].note_box[0].section: a violent clash
Four people were killed during violent clashes with the army.
a fierce/bitter clash
Fierce clashes swept across Bosnia and Croatia.
a serious clash
This was one of the most serious clashes since the two countries agreed to a ceasefire.
a minor clash
Minor clashes were reported to have taken place between police and students.
an armed clash
The violence could soon become armed clashes and even a war.
an ethnic clash
20 people died in ethnic clashes before Christmas.
lead to a clash
The anti-war protests led to violent clashes between police and demonstrators.
a clash occurs
A number of clashes occurred throughout the south between these opposing groups.
a clash breaks out
Armed clashes broke out on Tuesday between the military and the rebels.
a clash takes place
Fierce clashes took place with local police.
be killed/injured in a clash
Eight people were killed in clashes between the army and police.
clash.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: a British punk band which started performing in 1976. Their albums include The Clash and London Calling. Their success continued even when  punk was no longer fashionable.
